yaml.title: Exporting Survey Data from Qualtrics
yaml.subtitle: How to name variables and recode values
author: James Giallella
Shane McCarty, PhD
yaml.abstract: This chapter introduces students to import qualtrics features, such as recoding values in qualtrics before exporting the dataset.

markdown.markdown:
```{r}
#| include: false
current_date <- format(Sys.Date(), "%m.%d.%Y")

```


-   [ ] Log into Qualtrics: <https://binghamton.co1.qualtrics.com>

    -   [ ] Under Active surveys, click on your survey

-   [ ] Recode variables in Qualtrics

    -   [ ] Visit "Recode Values" section of the [Qualtrics guide](https://www.qualtrics.com/support/survey-platform/survey-module/question-options/recode-values/)

    -   [ ] Follow the instructions on how to [name and recode values](https://docs.google.com/document/d/15ynxeoIaLhABAAeDLJYV1MwQRwpI8LM24Zd3tOwxcFQ/edit?tab=t.0#heading=h.25d8wyh38wre)

## Export Survey Data

-   [ ] Log into Qualtrics: <https://binghamton.co1.qualtrics.com>
    -   [ ] Under Active surveys, click on your survey
-   [ ] At the top, go to Data & Analysis tab (top navigation bar)
    -   [ ] Ensure that "Data" is selected (from the second navigvation bar)

![*Click on Data & Analysis and ensure Data is underlined in the navigation bars.*](images/export-navbar.png)

-   [ ] On the upper right side, click Export & Import \^, then select Export Data...

-   [ ] Download the dataset (with download all fields checked and export *values* check – do not select export *labels* in two file formats:

    -   [ ] CSV

    -   [ ] Excel

-   [ ] Upload both files to "Team Survey Data" folder in your Team ELN

## Rename Files and Download

-   [ ] **Rename both files** using the date of the export in this format: MONTH.DAY.YEAR.filename.team#.filetype. For example, if the date is `{r} current_date` then the correct format of the files should be: `{r} current_date`.data.team1.csv and `{r} current_date`.data.team1.xlsx

-   [ ] **Make a copy** of the `{r} current_date`.data.team1.xlsx and rename it to: `{r} current_date`.data.team1.clean.xlsx.

-   [ ] In google sheets, **open up the file with .clean** added to the original file (i.e., `{r} current_date`.data.team1.clean.xlsx) and **delete the second row**. You'll notice that the dataset has two headers for variables and labels. You need to delete Row 2 to eliminate the labels.

-   [ ] Go to File \> **Download** \> Microsoft Excel.

Once you have completed these steps, you can move to the next chapter to import your data (`{r} current_date`.data.team1.clean.xlsx) to R or NVivo.
markdown.srcMarkdownNoYaml:
```{r}
#| include: false
current_date <- format(Sys.Date(), "%m.%d.%Y")

```

## Name and Recode Variables

-   [ ] Log into Qualtrics: <https://binghamton.co1.qualtrics.com>

    -   [ ] Under Active surveys, click on your survey

-   [ ] Recode variables in Qualtrics

    -   [ ] Visit "Recode Values" section of the [Qualtrics guide](https://www.qualtrics.com/support/survey-platform/survey-module/question-options/recode-values/)

    -   [ ] Follow the instructions on how to [name and recode values](https://docs.google.com/document/d/15ynxeoIaLhABAAeDLJYV1MwQRwpI8LM24Zd3tOwxcFQ/edit?tab=t.0#heading=h.25d8wyh38wre)

## Export Survey Data

-   [ ] Log into Qualtrics: <https://binghamton.co1.qualtrics.com>
    -   [ ] Under Active surveys, click on your survey
-   [ ] At the top, go to Data & Analysis tab (top navigation bar)
    -   [ ] Ensure that "Data" is selected (from the second navigvation bar)

![*Click on Data & Analysis and ensure Data is underlined in the navigation bars.*](images/export-navbar.png)

-   [ ] On the upper right side, click Export & Import \^, then select Export Data...

-   [ ] Download the dataset (with download all fields checked and export *values* check – do not select export *labels* in two file formats:

    -   [ ] CSV

    -   [ ] Excel

-   [ ] Upload both files to "Team Survey Data" folder in your Team ELN

## Rename Files and Download

-   [ ] **Rename both files** using the date of the export in this format: MONTH.DAY.YEAR.filename.team#.filetype. For example, if the date is `{r} current_date` then the correct format of the files should be: `{r} current_date`.data.team1.csv and `{r} current_date`.data.team1.xlsx

-   [ ] **Make a copy** of the `{r} current_date`.data.team1.xlsx and rename it to: `{r} current_date`.data.team1.clean.xlsx.

-   [ ] In google sheets, **open up the file with .clean** added to the original file (i.e., `{r} current_date`.data.team1.clean.xlsx) and **delete the second row**. You'll notice that the dataset has two headers for variables and labels. You need to delete Row 2 to eliminate the labels.

-   [ ] Go to File \> **Download** \> Microsoft Excel.

Once you have completed these steps, you can move to the next chapter to import your data (`{r} current_date`.data.team1.clean.xlsx) to R or NVivo.
